subject: Education
title: Ebbinghaus Forgetting Curve
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ebbinghaus Forgetting Curve.

hook.text: You forget 70% of what you learn within 24 hours. Hermann Ebbinghaus proved it in 1885.

buildup.text: He memorized nonsense syllables and tracked how quickly they faded over days.

discovery.text: Forgetting follows a predictable exponential curveâ€”steep at first, then gradually leveling off.

twist.text: Each review flattens the curve, making the next forgetting period longer.

climax.text: This discovery is the foundation of spaced repetition systems like Anki.

punchline.text: You will forget. But you can choose when.
